channel.title: 1 question (:
channel.description:
How can i do when you talk with a npc you get 2 choices yes,no if you choose yes the shop opens...
(:

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Under cases 9157 and 9158 in your client.java.

item.title: 1 question (:
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:2, topic:325607”]if (p.NpcDialogue == ####) { p.NpcDialogue = 0; p.NpcDialogueSend = false; p.openUpShop(#); }

if (p.NpcDialogue == ####) { p.NpcDialogue = 0; p.NpcDialogueSend = false; p.RemoveAllWindows(); }[/quote]

Where should i put those?

Read full topic

item.title: 1 question (:
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Declare this method in your ‘client’ Java file:

public void selectOption(String op1, String op2) { sendFrame171(1, 2465); sendFrame171(0, 2468); sendFrame126("Select an Option", 2460); sendFrame126(op1, 2461); sendFrame126(op2, 2462); sendFrame164(2459); }

Usage: selectOption(“Option 1”, “Option 2”);

Then under the cases 9157 and 9158 in your Buttons packet case/class, add the appropriate codes for either opening the shop or resetting the chatbox interface.

if (p.NpcDialogue == ####) { p.NpcDialogue = 0; p.NpcDialogueSend = false; p.openUpShop(#); }

if (p.NpcDialogue == ####) { p.NpcDialogue = 0; p.NpcDialogueSend = false; p.RemoveAllWindows(); }

Read full topic
